page.title: 13A SELBORNE FARMER
page.content: Mr Vining lives on a farm called Charity Farm in Newton Valence.He has lived there for 27 years.Before he came there he managed a dairy unit near Winchester.He has been farming most of his life and enjoys it.He was born on a farm in Somerset. After the war he farmed with his dad.He says farming is a very hard job,but nowadays most of it is done by machinery.He rents 223 acres.He has 86 cows,54 of these are young stock.They will soon join the dairy herd.5 cows are for beef.They are sold at 18 months.He has 46 hectares of grassland,22 hectares of wheat and 23 hectares of barley.He sells his milk to Home Country Dairies in Guildford. His cows give 11,000 litres a day in summer and 400,000,litres a year.He owns 3 tractors and he has 2 farm workers on his farm.
